meaningMnemonic:
Because the hiragana ends with an う sound, you know this word is a verb. It's also an intransitive verb, meaning the action happens on its own, you don't do it. The kanji itself means <kanji>place on</kanji>, and this means <vocabulary>to be placed on</vocabulary>.

載る is also often used to refer to something being included in a written document or publication and so can also mean <vocabulary>to be recorded</vocabulary>, as in 新聞に載る (to be recorded in a newspaper) or 教科書に載る (to be recorded in a textbook).
readingMnemonic:
